msItem.title: I. Daily Office Prayers
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; titles and incipits of the prayers, litanies, anaphoras; abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs. The words: ካዕበ፡ (ወካዕበ፡) and በዝየ፡

p.span: [Fol. 1r]: Morning Prayer of the Incense, from Egypt. And the deacon shall stand in front of the beginning of the place and he shall turn his face towards East and say: "Stand up for the prayer". The people say: "O Lord have mercy upon us"; the priest says: "Peace unto you all…"
[Fol. 25va]: …And our Saviour Jesus Christ, in whom for you and with you, and with the Holy Spirit glory and divinity and honour, now and for ever. World without end. The people say: Amen.

listBibl.bibl: CRAbb 70 (17th cent.), fol. 18v : “prières de l’encens pour le matin (ጸሎተ፡ ዕጣን፡ ዘነግህ፡)” (CRAbb 110, no. 72).
EMML no. 475 (1881/89), fols. 96r-97v: “Schematic rite of Incense [Ṣalota ‘eṭān]” (EMML II, 203).
EMML no. 1434 (1680), fols. 3r-10r: “Prayer of Incense [Ṣalota ‘eṭān]”: fol. 3v: “[Ṣalota ‘eṭān]”.

div.span: I-1) Fols. 1ra –5vb (l.6): Ṣälotä ˁǝṭan zä-nägǝh zä-Gǝbṣ “Morning Prayer of the Incense, from Egypt”.

I-2) Fols. 5vb (l.7) –8rb (l.7): Ṣälotä ˁǝṭan zä-śärk zä-Gǝbṣ “Evening Prayer of the Incense, from Egypt” (Ms. d’Abbadie 72, fol. 30r, CRAbb 110, no. 70, I. “prières de l’encens pour le soir, selon les Coptes (ጸሎተ፡ ዕጣን፡ ዘሰርክ፡ ዘግብጽ፡)”).

I-3) Fols. 8rb (l.17) – 8va (l.1): Särawitä mälaˀǝktihu lä-mädḫane ˁaläm yǝqäwwǝmu qǝdmehu lä-mädḫane ˁaläm wä-yǝkellǝlǝwwo… Fragment of “The Anaphora of the Three Hundred” (cp. MQ, “Qəddase śälästu məˀət”, §132; DMEthLit “The Anaphora of the Three Hundred, §132”) repeated 16 times, with different musical notation and different headings: Zä-sänuy “Of Monday”; Zä- räbuˁ “Of Wednesday”; Zä-ˁarb “Of Friday”; Zä-qädam “Of Saturday”; Zä-ˀəhud “Of Sunday”; Zäwätǝr “Of every day”; Zä-9 bäˁalät “Of nine feasts”; Zä-ˀǝgzǝˀtǝnä Maryam “Of Our Lady Maryam”; Zä-näbiyat “Of the prophets”; Zä-ḥawaryat “Of the Apostles”; ˁƎzl “(Mode of chant)”; Zä-ṣadqan “Of the righteous”; Zä-sämaˁ ǝtat “Of the martyrs”; Zä-mälaˀǝkt “Of the angels”; Araray “(Mode of chant)”; Zä-kirubel “Of Cherubs”.

I-4) Fols. 9vb (l. 12) – 10rb (l.7): Ṣälotä haymanot “Prayer of the Faith”, Confession of the Faith of 318 Fathers (MQ, “Qəddase śälästu məˀət”, §§1-10; DMEthLit, “The Anaphora of the Three Hundred, §§1-10”).
I-5) Fols. 10rb (l.8) – 14rb (l.3): Mäṣḥafä kidan “Book of the Testament”:
Kidan zä-nägh Introduction and “Testament of the Morning”; Kidan zä-śärk “Testament of the Evening”.
I-6) Fol. 14rb (l.3) – 14va (l.5): Liṭon zä-śärk “Litany of the Evening” (MSKLiton 15).

Mästäbqwǝˁ zä-lelit “Supplication of the Night” (MSKLiton 17-18, Mästäbqwǝˁan zäyǝbäqqwǝˁu lä-ṣälot bäˀǝntä kwǝllu gǝbr); Ṣäwatǝw zäˀabäwinä ḥawaryat “Series (of Supplications) of our Fathers the Apostles” (MSKLiton 18-26, from Mästäbqwǝˁ bä-ˀǝntä duyan to Mästäbqwǝˁ bä-ˀǝntä sälam).

note.div: Liṭon zä-sänuy “Litany of Monday”; Zä-śällus “Of Tuesday”; Zä-räbuˁ “(Litany) of Wednesday”; Zä-ḥamus “(Litany) of Thursday”; Zä-qädam“(Litany) of Saturday”; Zäˀǝhud “(Litany) of Sunday”; Zä-mäḫatǝwä Fasika “Of Easter Eve” (MSKLiton 8-17, from Liṭon zä-sänuy to Liṭon zä-qädam śǝˁur).

div.span: Wäkaˁǝbä nastäbǝqqwǝˁ. Bäl. ˀƎgziˀa ḥəywätä mutan täsfa qəbuṩan rädaˀe mənduban … (MSKLiton 38-40, the second part of Mästäbqwǝˁ bä-ˀǝntä ˀǝllä nomu);
Wäkaˁǝbä nastäbǝqqwǝˁ bä-ˀǝntä ˀǝllä nomu aḫawinä kämä näfsomu yagˁǝz wǝstä mäkan śǝˁur ḫabä mayä ˁǝräft … (MSKLiton 36-38, the first part of Mästäbqwǝˁ bä-ˀǝntä ˀǝllä nomu);

note.div: ˀƎgziˀabǝḥer ˀǝgziˀabǝḥer ˀIyäsus Krǝstos ˀamlakǝnä zä-tǝbelo lä-fǝqurǝkä Yoḥannǝs… (MSKLiton 40-41, Mästäbäqwǝˁ zä-ǝgzǝˀtǝnä Maryam); Wäkaˁǝbä nastäbǝqqwǝˁ lä-ǝgzǝˀtǝnä kwǝllǝnä Maryam ǝmmǝnä wä-ǝmu lä-ǝgziˀǝnä…; Wäkaˁǝbä nastäbǝqqwǝˁ lä-ˁǝṩä qǝddus mäsqäl ṣǝnuˁa śǝltan wä-ḫayl…

div.span: I-10) Fols. 22va (l.3) – 25vb (l.5): Mästäbqwǝˁ zä-lelit “Supplication of the Night”: Nastäbǝqqwǝˁ zä-kwǝllo yǝˀǝḫḫǝz ǝgziˀabǝḥer ab lä-ˀǝgzi wä mädḫaninä Iyäsus Krǝstos. ˀƎsmä räsäyännä tädlä…
I-11) Fols. 22vb (l.5) – 25vb (l.3): Zä-Yared zä-yǝnäggǝś “Zä-yǝnäggǝś of Yared” (MSKLiton 26-36).

msItem.title: II. Śәrʿatä qәddase "Ordinary of the Mass"
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; titles and incipits of the prayers, litanies, anaphoras; abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs. The words: ካዕበ፡ (ወካዕበ፡) and በዝየ፡

p.span: If there is a patriarch, or a bishop, or a priest, or a deacon who did not leard and does not know the Book of the Testament until the end, the Senodos, the Didascalia
, and the Ordinary of the Mass…

div.span: “The order of liturgy of St. Basil” (cp. MQ II, §§ 11-16;
Ṣälot zä-qǝddus Gorgoryos “Prayer of St. Gregory”.
Ṣälot gǝbˀatä mänṭolaˁt zä-qǝddus Basǝlyos” / “Prayer of St. Basil: the Entering of the Curtain”.
27va (1st line) – 30va (18th line): Ten prayers over the vessels of the Church.

The order of liturgy”: Śǝrˁatä qǝddase zä-yǝqeddes kahǝn yǝqum bä-fǝrhat. Mäqdämä kwǝllu yǝsgǝd qǝdmä tabot mǝˁǝrä… (the part until …yǝbarǝk wäyǝlbäs, fol. 31ra, is in MQ II, §§63-64; the rest from Mimäṭän gǝrǝmt… is in MQ III, §§1-3).
Ṣälot laˁlä mäsob “Prayer over the Basket”.
Ṣälot laˁlä mäbaˀ “Prayer over the offering (to God)”.
“The command of our fathers the Apostles”.
rayers of the solemn censing (cp. MQ III, §100 – IV; §§ 30).
47vb (l.13): Ceremonial washing of the hands (the Lavabo) (cp. MQ IV, §§46-48).
“Prayer of the Kiss (of Peace) of Basil” (MQ IV, §§52-61).

msItem.title: III. ʾAkkwätetä qwǝrban "Anaphoras"
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; titles and incipits of the prayers, litanies, anaphoras; abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs. The words: ካዕበ፡ (ወካዕበ፡) and በዝየ፡

p.span: Fol. 48rb, l.9 (Anaphora of the Apostles): ይካ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስለ፡ ኵልክሙ፡ ይሕ፡ ምስለ፡ መንፈስከ፡ ይካ፡ አእኵትዎ፡ ለአምላክነ፡…፨ አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘቅዱሳን፡ ወኅሩያን፡ አባዊነ፡ ሐዋርያት፡…ነአኲተከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ በፍቁር፡ ወልድከ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ዘበደኃሪ፡ መዋዕል፡…
Fol. 129vb: ... …ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ። ዘቦቱ፡ ለከ[n.l.]፡ እለ፡ ትቀውሙ፤ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘለዓለም፡ በል።

p.font: አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘቅዱሳን፡ ወኅሩያን፡ አባዊነ፡ ሐዋርያት፡…ነአኲተከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ በፍቁር፡ ወልድከ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ዘበደኃሪ፡ መዋዕል፡…
p.span: For fols. 58va-59ra, Y.d. bäsämay yähallu lәbbәkәmu… zä-hallo wä-yәhellu wäträ bä-sämay w-mәdr, s. MQ IV, Qәddase әgziˀ, §§ 2-16.
Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (
አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘእግዚእነ፡ ወአምላክነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘሎቱ፡ ስብሐት። በረከተ፡ ጸጋሁ፡ ያዕርፍ፡ ላዕለ፡ ነፍስ፡…
The excerpt from the Testamentum Domini (Ǝmmäṣḥafä kidan zä-nägäromu lä-ḥawaryat…, cp. MQ
Anaphora of Our Lady by Cyriacus of Behnesa (

font.span: አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘአባ፡ ሕርቆስ፡ ጳጳስ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ብንሕሳ፡ ዘደረስ፡ በእንተ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብረ፡ ለእግዚእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ …

p.span: Anaphora of St. John, son of Thunder (fols. 70ra, l.5 – 76rb, l.21):

font.span: አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ነጐድጓድ። ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ፡
ክርስቶስ። ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ወኵሉ፡ ሥርዓቱ፡ ከመ፡ ቅዳሴ፡ ሐዋርያት።

p.span: Reading of the Hallowing for each Monday, by Gregory of Nyssa (fol. 77vb, ls.5 – 16):
ምንባብ፡ ቅዳሴ፡ ዘበዕለቱ፡ በሰነይ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ ዘእንዚናዙ፡…
Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols.
አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘአበዊነ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ፫፻፲ወ፰፡ ርቱዓነ፡
ዘነበቡ፡ ኅቡረ፡ በ፩፡ ቃል። ጸሎቶሙ፡ ወረከቶሙ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ገብሮሙ፡ አቡየ፡ ወረደ፡ ቃል፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፤
አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ በረከከቱ
]፡ ቅድስት፡ ትኩን፡ ምስለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ተወልደ፡ መድኅ

አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘአቡነ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አትናቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳ
፡ ዘእስክንድርያ። ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ገብሩ፡ ተወልደ፡ መድኅን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።

Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols.
አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ኤጴፋንዮስ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረ
ቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ፡ ተወልደ፡ መድኅን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም። አሜን። ዓቢይ፡ ውእቱ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በዕበዩ፡ ቅዱስ፡ በቅዳሴሁ፡ እኩት፡ በአኰቴቱ፡ ወስ
Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (
አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ዲዮስቆሮስ። ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ገብሩ፡ ተወልደ፡ መድኅን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። እምቅድመ፡ ዓለም፡ ወእስከ፡ ለዓለም፡ ሀሎ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በመንግሥቱ።
is missing at the end (cp. MQ IV, Qәddase Diyosqoros, §§66-70), instead the remark
Anaphora of St. Gregory of Nyssa (
አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ ዘእንዚናዙ፡ በረከተ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ዓመቱ፡ ኅደረ፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም። አሜን። ይዲ፡ ጸልዩ፡ በእንተ፡ አበዊነ፡ ጳጳሳት፡
The end slightly differs from MQ, IV, Qәddase Gorgoryos, §105.

span.font: አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘአቡነ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ ዘአርማንያ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ገብሩ፡

font.span: ክርስቶስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ነአኵተከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ ንሴብሐከ፡ ወንዌድስከ፡ ቡሩክ፡ ስምከ፡ ወንባርከከ፡ ንሕነኒ።

p.span: The Anbәro ˀәd is different from MQ, IV, Qәddase Gorgoryos kalәˀ, §§72-76.
Ṣälotä fättǝto zä-qǝddase ḥawaryat “Prayer of the Fraction (of the Eucharistic bread) of the Anaphora of the Apostles” (fols. 129va, l.10 – 129vb, l.23). Different from the Ṣälotä fättǝto in the
; seems to be added later, but by the same hand.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 134.0 folios, of which 2.0 blank , in 18.0 quires (A+17).
19.7 17.0 8.6
supportDesc.condition: The Ms. is very worn, many leaves are dirty. The spine cover and the endbands are torn off.

layout.ab: The pricking and ruling are visible.
Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 7v).
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: Colon with dashes above and below.
Doubled nine dot asterisks (s. fols. 61va, 102va, and throughout the Ms.).
Five dot asterisks with dashes above and below, only in passages on fol. 77vb (ls. 9, 10, 11) and fol. 129vb (l. 21).
III.Three and more nine dot asterisks (s. esp. fols. 5vb, 8rb, 14va, 22va, 25vb, 58va, 70ra, 84vb, 107rb, 114vb, 120ra, 129va);
Doubled four dot asterisk, with lines in between ።==። (s. esp. fols. 33vb, 90rb, 94rb, 98va, 109va, 110rb, 113va, 114vb, 115vb, 119vb);
Four dot asterisk connected with lines።==።==።==። (s. esp. fol. 33va, fol. 86ra);
Nine dot asterisks and chain of black and red dots (s. esp. fols. 5vb, 8rb, 10va, 11rab, 14va, 22va, 25vb, 58va, 61va, 61va, 70ra, 84vb, 89rb, 98ra, 102va, 107rb, 109va, 120ra, 129va).

handNote.ab: Careful and regular, by well-trained hand.

p.span: Fols. 130ra, l.1- 131vb, l.17: Calendaric calculations and a register of church feasts.
Fol. 131vb, l.18: ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘአሲር፡ መ
Fol. 132vb, ls. 1-26: Ownership note extended with the record concerning the land issues.

item.p: The note is a version of the previous one, somewhat longer and with some differences. The final part is unintelligible.

list.item: - Crude note on fol. II: መምሕር፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ መምሕር፡ ወልደ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ መምሕር፡ ወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ወልደ፡ ገብረ፡ መድኅን - Crude note in the upper margin of fol. 70r: ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም - Other crude notes in the upper margin of the fols., referring to the liturgical useof the Ms.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather, textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Quires A, I are reinforced by parchment guards made of re-utilized leaves of a different (older?) manuscript.

origin.origDate: 1706-08 or 1769-77 A.D. Additio 4 is followed by a hardly readable addition (fol. 132vb) which contains a hint to dating: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ […] በዘመነ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ፪ቲ፡ … “This book […] at the time of our King Täklä Haymanot, the second … (?)”. Probably King Täklä Haymanot I (1706-08) or II (r. 1769-1777) is meant.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: According to Additiones 2-4, the donor is ʾabba Wärädä Qal (fols. 98ra, 114vb, 131vb, 132ra, 132rb); his son Täwäldä Mädḫǝn is also mentioned (fols. 84vb, 102va, 107rb).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
